Competition Overview.Description: The Titanic - Machine Learning from Disaster competition is a beginner-friendly challenge on Kaggle where participants build a predictive model to determine which passengers survived the Titanic shipwreck using passenger data.
Competition Overview.Goal: Predict if a passenger survived the sinking of the Titanic or not using machine learning models.

train.csv.Purpose: Contains details of 891 passengers, including whether they survived or not. Used for training the model.
train.csv.Usage: Build and train the machine learning model.

test.csv.Purpose: Contains details of 418 passengers without survival information. Used for testing the model.
test.csv.Usage: Predict survival outcomes using the trained model.

gender_submission.csv.Purpose: An example submission file assuming all female passengers survived.
gender_submission.csv.Usage: Reference for the required submission format.

Problem Definition.Question: What sorts of people were more likely to survive the Titanic shipwreck?
Problem Definition.Requirements: Build a predictive model using passenger data to answer the question.

Structure.train.csv: Contains 891 rows and multiple columns including survival status.
Structure.test.csv: Contains 418 rows and similar columns without survival status.

Variables.name: sibsp
Variables.definition: # of siblings / spouses aboard the Titanic

Variables.name: parch
Variables.definition: # of parents / children aboard the Titanic

Variables.name: embarked
Variables.key: C = Cherbourg, Q = Queenstown, S = Southampton

Target Variable.name: Survived
Target Variable.definition: Indicates whether the passenger survived (1) or not (0).

Evaluation Metrics.Definition: Percentage of correctly predicted survival outcomes.

Submission Format.Format: CSV file with exactly 418 entries plus a header row.

Other Key Aspects.Kaggle Notebooks: Kaggle provides a no-setup, customizable Jupyter Notebooks environment with free GPUs for building and sharing models.
Other Key Aspects.Discussion Forum: A valuable resource for tutorials, insights, and community support.
Other Key Aspects.Rolling Leaderboard: Submissions older than two months are invalidated to keep the leaderboard fresh.
